snippet: According to the city’s Finance Department, a house in Queens has the only private space remaining in the city to qualify for a tax credit for bomb shelters.
abstract: New York City records show that Queens home owned by Francisco Lago for the last 30 years has the only remaining private stand-alone bomb shelter in the city; historical curiosity of the Cold War era carries a tangible benefit for Lago--a tax exemption that has saved him thousands of dollars over the years.

byline.original: By SAM ROBERTS and NOAH ROSENBERG

lead_paragraph: According to the city’s Finance Department, a house in Queens has the only private space remaining in the city to qualify for a tax credit for bomb shelters.

headline.seo: For Some, a Tax Credit for Cold War Bomb Shelters Continues to Pay Off
headline.main: A Profitable Vestige of Cold War Precaution
headline.print_headline: A Profitable Vestige of Cold War Precaution
